data.title: Bike to Multnomah Falls on the Historic Columbia River Highway
data.meta_description: Experience America's first scenic biway as it was originally intended with stops at 6 Columbia River Gorge waterfalls including Multnomah Falls, Bridal Veil Falls, Wahkeena Falls, Horsetail Falls, Latourell Falls, and Shepperds Dell. Beat the traffi, get a front row spot and spend more time enjoying the falls!
data.text:
Why is E-Biking better?

No permit required to visit Multnomah Falls by bike

Get a front row parking spot at every waterfall.

Immerse yourself in the Gorge, find the hidden waterfalls and swimming holes others drive by.

Feel, smell, and see the most scenic stretch of Historic Columbia River Highway in the open air as it was intended.

Enjoy a seamless, stress free experience with free secure parking and everything you need provided.

Since 1915 travelers have explored Waterfall Alley on bikes. Featuring six huge waterfalls including 620-foot Multnomah Falls with roadside viewing areas and bridges built to view the waterfalls, The Historic Columbia River Highway Scenic Byway is unforgettable.

Our Rad Power Bikes are easy to learn and to ride. Water bottle holders, racks, comfy seats, mirrors, and lights provide a premium experience. Park at our location just .5 miles from the first waterfall and we’re there to make sure you know where to go, how to use the bike, and how to ride safely. On Google (4.9 stars) our customers say that they felt safe, and that drivers were courteous on this slow going route.
